Authors:
Masako Senda, C. André Lévesque, Haruhisa Suga, Koji
Kageyama
Title:
Two new species of Pythium isolated from cool-temperate
forest soil in Japan.
Abstract:
Pythium senticosum and P. takayamanum spp. nov. were
isolated from the A horizon layer of the soils under deciduous
broad-leaved forest and cool-temperate cedar forest of Japan,
respectively. P. senticosum is a fast-growing species and grows even at
5˚C with a radial growth. The species is characterized by the ovoid to
ellipsoid sporangia with an apical papilla, the ornamented oogonia with
acute conical spines, the bell-shaped antheridial cells and the
amphigynous-like antheridia. P. takayamanum is a high-temperature
growing species that can grow even at 35˚C. The species is
morphologically characterized by the wavy antheridial stalk and
ellipsoidal bent oogonia.
